column4: HI all, my laptop can connect easily to some wireless networks and cannot connect to others (all WPA)... anyone can help please?
Might be a channel problem. Type sudo iwlist scan
Are the networks you want listed there?
antiphysics: USB is about it I'm afraid - you need something independant from the main hardware.
yup
btw I have another laptop connected to that network now (From wich i'm talking)
Then you might have to go into the router settings and change the channel. That command I just gave you also gives the channel.
I can't guarantee it's the solution, but it's worked for me in the past - my family got online OK, mine dd not. Changed the router channel an hey presto.
It's a shared network, I've no access to the settings :(
That sucks. Tell which SSID you want to connect to then paste the output of sudo iwlist scan
Sorry for all the typos, crap wireless keyboard.
np :)
http://pastebin.com/tMkuUHfD
I just don't see it I'm afraid, can't help thinking it's a channel issue. Especially since you can connect to others.
do you have any idea how to reset all network settings? I already tried to remove network manager and reinstall it, but he keeps all settings...
it'll be in a config file somwhere I guess. Have you tried wicd?
sometime that works for people.
yup, I always use wicd, but when I started having troubles, I moved back to network manager
yup, I always use wicd, but when I started having troubles, I moved back to network manager
then I'm all out of ideas I'm afraid. You can remove individual networks from network-manager in the 'edit connections' dialog.
I already tried that... thanks anyway for your time :)
